alert.note: Alert for Concho; Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 12:41AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Kimble, McCulloch, eastern Menard, northern Mason, southeastern Concho and southwestern San Saba Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1240 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Melvin, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These strong thunderstorms will be near... Calf Creek around 110 AM CDT. Hext around 120 AM CDT. Camp Air, Katemcy and Grit around 130 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1773, Erna, Us-190 Near The Menard- Mcculloch County Line, The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 1311, Us-377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Highway 29 and Koockville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
